triples.name: World Values Survey
triples.relevance: The paper applies the fixation index to World Values Survey data to measure cultural distance between societies.

triples.name: Fixation index
triples.relevance: A population genetics statistic applied to cultural data as a novel method for measuring psychological and cultural distance.

triples.name: Psychological distance
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a new method for measuring psychological distance between societies using cultural data.

triples.name: Cross-cultural psychology
triples.relevance: The paper addresses concerns about WEIRD bias in cross-cultural psychological research by developing distance measures.

triples.name: Hofstede's cultural dimensions theory
triples.relevance: Provides a theoretical framework for understanding cultural differences that motivates the need for measuring cultural distance.

triples.name: The WEIRDest People in the World
triples.relevance: The paper directly addresses the WEIRD (Western, Educated, Industrialized, Rich, Democratic) bias documented in psychological research.
